children.subject: Well I guess @684 was more about last week and not this week.
@684 may help you figure out the answer to your question.

history.content:
I don't recall exactly what is in each section. 
You need the max-flow section sections for this exam.  The linear programming sections are for the 3rd exam.

Hi All,

Does anyone have a definitive list of the sections of chapter 7 we need to read for this week?  The chapter seems to split flows and linear programming, with linear programming being the next lesson (and exam, as ch7 is also listed for the week of 10/30 and 11/6 on the official schedule).

As I mentioned elsewhere, this exam period is a bit squeezed due to the project, so I am looking to maximize the flow here with a few bottleneck paths :)

I have a guess that its just 7.2, but I would like confirmation lest I skip a section and see it on Exam 2.  Here all all subsections, my guesses on which are due are bolded:

7.1 An Introduction To Linear Programming (I guess not to fully understand Linear Programming just yet but needed to understand the next section)

7.2 Flows In Networks

7.3 Bipartite Matching

7.4 Duality

7.5 Zero-sum Games

7.6 The Simplex Algorithm

7.7 Postscript: Circuit Evaluation

Am I correct that from 7.3 on will be exam 3 material, with 7.2 being our reading for the week?

EDIT: I am just looking over the homework now, seems the questions are from ch5 and not 7? I am a bit confused, as the schedule mentions 7 for this week.

Side question: Is it possible to understand the reading without the linear programming just yet?

Thanks,

Brent
history.subject: What DPV Sections For This Week?
